before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"565r6","text":"Checks Made Prior to Beginning Test Procedure","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4i68","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpkr9","text":"We run standard and make sure the retention time drift for each analyte should be within 15%.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aeuv1","text":"The purpose of this SOP is to describe how to determine the presence of aflatoxin B1 (AFB1) and aflatoxin M1 (AFM1) in urine with pre-column derivatization by high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) with fluorescence detector.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gpv6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rrss","text":"Quantitation range: 0.5-15 ng/g (ppb). Note, sensitivity of the method greatly depends on sensitivity of the fluorescent detector. The method requires 2mL of urine. Quantitation is based on matrix-matched calibration curve. Analytes (AfB1 and AfM1) are extracted, derivatized, cleaned up using Octadecyl (C18) material, injected into HPLC, chromatographed on C18 column and quantitated using Fluorescence detector","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcv66","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n9d2","text":"Validation data (in-house and via collaborative studies such as Blinded Method Tests) are available in the following two publications:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69t9d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9opbs","text":" https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28985321/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ud0g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4fml","text":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/36912688/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"02801749276F11EE867F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28985321"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FA82B09A276E11EE867F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/36912688"}}}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6q78l","text":"1. The correlation coefficient R2 value for the standard curve must be \u003e0.99. The back calculated deviation for each points ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88r79","text":"must be within 20%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99rtj","text":".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3utgk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqd20","text":"2. The method for detection of AFB1 and AFM1 was validated in glassware. 7 mL borosilicate glass scintillation vials are also suitable for this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86vva","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8agh","text":"3. The method for detection of AFB1 and AFM1 was validated in glassware. 50 mL screw cap glass tube is also suitable for this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t35","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mh04","text":"4. Each lab should perform a practice run to check the optimal incubation time and HPLC run time at three levels (low at 0.8 ppb, medium at 5 ppb, and high at 10 ppb). After incubation, inject samples at 20 h, 24 h, 28 h, and 32 h to check signal drift for each aflatoxin. The optimal incubation time is the time when minimal signal drift is observed. A signal drift of ± 15% is acceptable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nb5g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96s1c","text":"5. The HPLC run time is optimal as long as the last eluting peak has returned to the baseline (2-4 minutes) before the run has ended. The validated run time is 33 minutes, if needed the run time can be extended in 5-10 minute increments until the run time has been optimized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: aflatoxin B1, aflatoxin M1, urine, animals, HPLC-FLD
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"387p3","text":"Equipment/Materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fed7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7697k","text":"Balances. Capable of weighing minimum: 0.01 g (Mettler Toledo or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nlmg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd4ol","text":"Centrifuges. Bench top centrifuge (IEC Centra-GP8 or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be4av","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8ut6","text":"Mixers and shakers. Single tube vortex mixer (VWR or equivalent), Fisher Multi-tube Vortexer (Thermo Scientific or equivalent), Rotor rack shaker (LabQuake, Thermo Scientific or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cecu9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7vv5","text":"Pipettes. Variable pipettes to cover ranges of 1-10 μL, 10-100 μL, 100-1000 μL, and 1-10 mL. (Rainin or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evnml","text":"Digital Heating bath (GeneMate or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as1et","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67o70","text":"A Waters HPLC or equivalent equipped with a Waters 2695 separation module including a vacuum degasser, a quaternary pump, an automatic sample injection system, a Waters 2475 Multi-wavelength fluorescence detector or equivalent, and the Empower software or equivalent to control the instrument, data acquisition, and data analysis is used for separation and quantification of aflatoxins (or equivalent).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48hqh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8r27e","text":"HPLC column. Biphenyl reversed phase column (Kinetex Biphenyl, 2.6 μm, 100 Å, 100 mm × 4.6 mm, Phenomenex, Torrance, CA, USA, part #: 00D-4622-E0). A guard column (Agilent, Polaris C18-A, MetaGuard, 5 μm, 2.0 mm, part #: A2000MG2) is used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t586","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pttn","text":"Clean-up immuno-affinity column AFLAPREP, R-Biopharm AG (Washington, MO, USA). Part #: P07.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7o5uf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82ebj","text":"7 mL borosilicate glass scintillation vials, Fisher Scientific (Waltham, MA, USA). Part #: 03-337-26.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17i8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jjub","text":"15 mL Falcon conical centrifuge tubes, Fisher Scientific (Waltham, MA, USA). Part #: 14-959-49B.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clmtr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"412qv","text":"Syringes, 30 mL, Monoject, Kendall. status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Preparation of Standard Stock Solutions and Reagents
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8cpmv","text":"The standard stock solutions of each aflatoxin is prepared by dissolving the pre-weighed standard in methanol (AFB1) or chloroform (AFM1) and stored in -20 °C when not in use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em5v1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m11n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"mv63","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d76ks","text":"The reference standard of aflatoxins was purchased from Sigma-Aldrich (St-Louis, MO, USA). AFB1 part #: A-6636; AFM1 part #: A-6428.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of Standard Stock Solutions and Reagents
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"hh1d","text":"A working mixed standard solution (250 ng/mL for each aflatoxin) is prepared. Quantitatively transfer   of the AFM1 stock standard and  of the AFB1 stock standard to a 7 mL scintillation glass vial. Concentrate to dryness by nitrogen effusion and dilute in  methanol. It is stored at -20 °C when not in use and is good for one year.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":102,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":134,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":256,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"953h0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"0284D660C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"04A28640C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"0A6FD0A0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45gcs","text":"Urine samples were pooled into a beaker and stirred with a stir bar for  . After homogenization, the urine was transferred into 50 mL centrifuge tubes and centrifuged at 3800 rpm for   to remove precipitates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":183,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3bilu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"20083A10C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"2B5E99E0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7oltu","text":"The centrifuged urine sample was transferred into brown plastic bottles and stored at -80 oC before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of Standard Stock Solutions and Reagents
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"kidv","text":"Example: A   AFM1 standard is dissolved in   of chloroform to make a   stock standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dlom1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"E851D630C81111ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"EB0C8960C81111ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"ED037760C81111ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3011}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of Standard Stock Solutions and Reagents
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"735dm","text":"A working mixed standard solution (25 ng/mL) is prepared by dilution of the 250 ng/mL mixed standard solution using methanol. It is prepared on the day of use. Transfer   of the 250 ng/mL mixed standard to a 7 mL vial, add   of methanol and vortex to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":169,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":223,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6aonq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"140CE7B0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4.5","error":false,"guid":"19B1C280C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0ta7","text":"Preparation of calibration curve in urine matrix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nspq","text":"Thaw samples stored in -80 °C freezer in a water bath and centrifuge the blank urine samples in plastic centrifuge tubes at 3800 rpm for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":137,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9af60","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"3AF5FEC0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bbr30","text":"Seven control urine samples are weighed into 15 mL Falcon plastic polypropylene conical tubes (See Guideline 2). A series of volumes (4 μL, 8 μL, 16 μL, 40 μL, 80 μL and 120 μL ) of the 250 ng/mL working standard solution of AFB1 and AFM1 is added to the   control urine to give a series of fortified concentration of 0.5, 1, 2, 5, 10, 15 ng/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":255,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fks29","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"43B8E270C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.0","error":false,"guid":"6720E910C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pi6f","text":"The fortified samples are mixed thoroughly by vortexing for   at maximum speed and subject to the following steps 7-9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ti0t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"712A2F70C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cqaeg","text":"Extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ftq5t","text":"Add   80/20 (v/v) methanol/water to the samples. Vortex at 2500 speed for using the Fisher Multi-tube Vortexer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"em25r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"92556570C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"95F3E8F0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gg9v","text":"Pipet   solution into a 50 mL plastic conical-bottom centrifuge tube (See Appendix 3).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9d9o9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"A000B1C0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8flql","text":"Dilute the   solution with   1X PBS solution, vortex for ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":27,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9tun9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"C37DC700C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"14","error":false,"guid":"C72CEC50C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5,"guid":"C8D9D900C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"mrul","text":"Clean up","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"biho9","text":"Immuno-affinity columns (stored at 5 C) are mounted on the vacuum container with the other end of the column connected with 30 mL syringes through adaptors before use. Ensure that the column has not dried out and contains buffer above the gel when loading the   PBS solution. (It is important to note that the antibody included in the immuno-affinity column can be denatured by extreme temperature or pH change).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":260,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8llkk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"16.0","error":false,"guid":"D2BAFDF0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvik3","text":"Pass solutions through the columns at a steady slow rate of 0.25 - 0.5 mL/min under vacuum or by gravity (This has to be followed exactly). A slow, steady flow rate is essential for the capture of the aflatoxins by the antibody.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"732gm","text":"Wash columns by passing   1x PBS solution, at a flow rate of approximately 1 drop/sec (3 mL/min). Pass air through the column to remove residual liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"clm4q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"DEA9F440C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dn11","text":"Elute the analytes from the column using 1.0 mL of methanol and collect the eluents in new tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ter6","text":"Pass 1.0 mL deionized water through the column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2abb4","text":"Collect in the same tubes to give a   total volume. A backflush is needed to remove residual liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ediq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"E8DD57E0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1aokk","text":"The eluates collected in last two steps are transferred to 7 mL glass scintillation vial. The tubes are washed with 2 x 0.5 mL methanol. The solutions are concentrated to dryness under gentle nitrogen stream at ambient temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"26i2h","text":"Derivatization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ftde","text":"The residue obtained in the previous step are reconstituted in   35/10/5 (v/v/v) water/TFA/glacial acetic acid, vortexed for   at maximum speed, then heated at 65 °C in heating block for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":63,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":125,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":187,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1jta0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"F1914770C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"F4F6E0A0C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"F6D8C000C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ambko","text":"The solutions obtained from this step are incubated at least for   (This incubation time needs to be optimized under each lab’s conditions, see Appendix 5.3) at room temperature before HPLC analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9j6d0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":72000,"guid":"FD9C2A30C81211ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3inc6","text":"The calibration curve is established by plotting the fluorescence intensity (in peak area, fluorescence unit) versus the injected mass of standard (in ng) by linear regression. The concentration of the unknown sample is calculated based on this standard curve.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i5ff","text":"See [9.3444, current version] Procedure for entering results in ISULIMS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9tn2e","text":"The optimized excitation and emission wavelengths for the fluorescence detector are 360 and 440 nm, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"csme6","text":"Retention time: A total running time of   is normally used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1980,"guid":"3BD55C70C81411ED9BBD0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6dtmv","text":"An injection volume of  is used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"39ADC15DC81411ED9BBD0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fvv7","text":"The mobile phase consisting of water (A) and acetonitrile (B) is pumped at a flow rate of 1 mL/min. A gradient elution is used to give the optimized separation. The details of the gradient program are as follows: 1 min isocratic step at 100% A; 1 min linear gradient (1-2 min) to 84% A and 16% B; an isocratic step from 2 to 16 min at 84% A and 16% B; a 1 min linear gradient (16-17 min) to 80% A and 20% B; an isocratic step from 17 to 27 min at 80% A and 20% B; 1 min linear gradient (27-28 min) to 100% A; and a final isocratic step at 100% A to the end (28-33 min)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of Standard Stock Solutions and Reagents
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b9392","text":"Derivatization reagent 35/10/5 (v/v) water/TFA/glacial acetic acid: Mix  TFA with   glacial acetic acid and  L deionized water. The mixture is mounted on Roto rack for rotate-mixing for  , then stored in dark or aluminum-foil-wrapped bottles. This amount is good for about 100-120 samples. We suggest this is good for 3 months","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":82,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":108,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":186,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"54fun","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"D6269FB0C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"D7B5F240C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"35","error":false,"guid":"D9D772B0C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"DD0F4520C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of Standard Stock Solutions and Reagents
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"56hpf","text":"1x Phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) solution is prepared by adding   NaCl,   KCl,   Na2HPO4, and   KH2PO4 in   deionized water and adjust the pH to 7.4 with 1 M HCl, then diluted to   with deionized water. This amount is good for about 25-28 samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":74,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":82,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":96,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":108,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":181,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1a2on","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"sample","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":null,"entityMap":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.20","error":false,"guid":"BBDEDF00C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.44","error":false,"guid":"C0238D90C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.24","error":false,"guid":"C3766210C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"800","error":false,"guid":"C5B0E8C0C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.0","error":false,"guid":"D2794F20C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of Standard Stock Solutions and Reagents
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e2o3i","text":"1 M HCl solution is prepared by adding   of concentrated HCl and diluting it in a volumetric flask to 100 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4grvv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"8.3","error":false,"guid":"ACDE62F0C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of Standard Stock Solutions and Reagents
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"kenf","text":"Methanol/water 80/20 (v/v) is prepared by adding deionized water to   methanol. This amount is good for about 75-80 samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9rmir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"80","error":false,"guid":"A3316D60C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"320","error":false,"guid":"A47B2B70C81411ED9D4C5536FF487267","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"58lc5","text":"SAFETY CONSIDERATIONS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8m41","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rhlh","text":"See [9.1399, current version] Policy for Personal Protective Equipment and Safe Laboratory Practices.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17ho2","text":"See Applicable SDS.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpor","text":"Considerations specific for this procedure:AFB1 and AFM1 are toxic and carcinogenic and hence should be handled with extreme care.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
